perturbation.original_text: THIS SECOND AMENDMENT TO CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT (this "Amendment") is made and entered into, effective for all purposes and in all respects as of the 23rd day of February, 1998, by and between PC QUOTE, INC., with its principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60605 ("PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc., with its principal place of business at 33 West 17th Street, New York, New York 10011 ("ABW").
perturbation.changed_text: THIS SECOND AMENDMENT TO CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT (this "Addendum") is made and entered into, effective for all purposes and in all respects as of the 23rd day of February, 1998, by and between PC QUOTE, INC., with its principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60605 ("PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc., with its principal place of business at 33 West 17th Street, New York, New York 10011 ("ABW").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Amendment' is replaced with 'Addendum.' Throughout the document, 'Amendment' is used consistently. Changing it introduces confusion as to whether the document is an 'Amendment' or a separate 'Addendum,' impacting interpretation and enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding Contract dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Agreement' is replaced with 'Contract' in one instance. While seemingly synonymous, this creates ambiguity: Does 'Agreement' in other sections refer to the original 'Co-Branding Agreement' or the 'Co-Branding Contract,' especially concerning provisions incorporated by reference?

perturbation.original_text: To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all respects.
perturbation.changed_text: To the extent, if any, that any stipulation of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Document, such provision of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all respects.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'provision' replaced with 'stipulation' and 'Agreement' replaced with 'Document'. Since 'Document' is not defined, this creates ambiguity. Does this Amendment take precedence over the original Agreement or some other undefined 'Document'? The term 'stipulation' could also add a layer of ambiguity
